Join us as we welcome our honored guests from West Sydney University,Australia.

【2024 Indigenous Knowledge Public Lecture Series】

◎Speaker : Dr. Gawaian Bodkin-Andrews 
◎Topic : Honouring the Lore/Law of the Lyrebird: Resisting Colonial Storytelling with Indigenous Storywork. 
◎Date : 28 Nov 2024 14:00-16:00 
◎Location：CIS A318

Speaker : Dr. Gawaian Bodkin-Andrews (Director, Indigenous Research at Western Sydney University)
Speaker Biography: Dr. Gawaian Bodkin-Andrews is a proud inland D’harawal man born in Sydney and is directly connected to Bidigal (Bitter-Water) and Nattaimattagal (Fresh-Water) Country around South-West Sydney. He is currently the Director of Indigenous Research at Western Sydney University, a founding member of the Maiam nayri Wingara Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Collective, and his work focuses on Indigenous Studies, Indigenous Research Methodologies, Indigenous Storywork, Indigenous Data Sovereignty, Indigenous education, Indigenous psychology, and racism.
